title: Cauliflower cheese with fennel and apple salad
text:
In my grandmother's fridge there was a jar of cheese. It was where ends of cheese went to die, only to live again in a white sauce, a brilliant if slightly unorthodox carbonara, or to be stirred through a leek and potato soup. It was her own homemade flavour enhancer. Almost certainly unsanitary, but a risk worth taking for a truly exemplary cheese sauce.

Cauliflower cheese always seems such a great way to use up those odds and ends we all have lurking in the fridge. It’s also the perfect way to usher in autumnal evenings in the kitchen, particularly as it seems we have gone from summer to interminable rain in the blink of an eye. The salad (to which you could add a handful of watercress, or...
description: In my grandmother's fridge there was a jar of cheese.
